question_templates: What does the prefix '{prefix}' mean?
Add the prefix '{prefix}' to '{word}'. What new word do you make?
What is the meaning of '{word}' with the prefix '{prefix}'?
What does the suffix '{suffix}' mean?
Add '{suffix}' to '{word}'. What new word do you make?
If '{word}' means '{meaning}', what does '{new_word}' mean?
What two words make up '{compound}'?
Put '{word1}' and '{word2}' together. What word do you get?
What does '{compound}' mean?

compound_words.meaning: a flower that faces the sun
colorful arc in the sky after rain
a flat cake cooked in a pan
a sea animal shaped like a star

question_templates: What does '{word}' mean in this sentence?
Use context clues to figure out what '{word}' means.
Which word could replace '{word}' in this sentence?

context_sentences.sentence: The gigantic elephant was the biggest animal at the zoo.
She was famished after not eating all day, so she ate a huge dinner.
The swift rabbit ran so fast that the fox could not catch it.
The timid mouse was too scared to come out of its hole.
The gloomy sky was dark and gray, like it might rain.
She was elated when she won the prize and jumped up and down with joy.
context_sentences.clue: jumped up and down with joy

context_sentences.sentence: The ancient tree was hundreds of years old.
The peculiar sound was strange and unlike anything I had heard before.

question_templates: What is a synonym for '{word}'?
What is an antonym for '{word}'?
Which word means the same as '{word}'?
Which word means the opposite of '{word}'?
Who {action}?
What did {character} do?
Where did the story happen?
When did {event} happen?
Why did {character} {action}?

passages.title: The Garden Helper
passages.text: Every Saturday, Marcus helps his grandmother in her garden. They pull weeds and water the plants together. Grandma teaches Marcus the names of all the flowers. His favorite is the sunflower because it is so tall. At the end of the day, Grandma always makes lemonade.

questions.what: They work in the garden together
questions.why: To help Grandma and learn about plants

passages.title: The Rainy Day
passages.text: Sophie woke up to the sound of rain on her window. She had planned to go to the park, but now she was stuck inside. Instead, she decided to build a fort with blankets and pillows. Her little brother helped her. They pretended the fort was a castle, and they were brave knights.

questions.why: Because they couldn't go to the park

question_templates: What happened at the beginning of the story?
What happened in the middle?
How did the story end?
What was the problem? How was it solved?

structure_stories.title: The Missing Toy
structure_stories.beginning: Ben could not find his favorite toy truck. He looked under his bed and in his closet.
structure_stories.middle: Ben asked his mom for help. They looked in the living room and kitchen. Then Ben remembered he played outside yesterday.
structure_stories.end: They went to the backyard and found the truck by the swing. Ben was so happy!
structure_stories.solution: He remembered where he last played and found it

structure_stories.title: The Class Pet
structure_stories.beginning: Mrs. Lopez brought a hamster to class. Everyone wanted to hold it.
structure_stories.middle: The class had to learn how to be gentle and quiet around the hamster. They took turns feeding it and cleaning its cage.
structure_stories.end: By the end of the year, everyone loved taking care of the hamster. They named it Fuzzy.
structure_stories.problem: The class needed to learn responsibility
structure_stories.solution: They learned by taking care of the hamster together

question_templates: Is this story fiction or nonfiction?
How do you know this is {type}?
What clues tell you this is {type}?

examples.text: Dragons flew over the castle, breathing fire at the knights below.
The sun is a star. It gives Earth light and heat.
examples.clue: It gives facts about the sun

examples.text: The dog talked to the cat about their plan to get treats.
Polar bears live in the Arctic. They have thick white fur to stay warm.
examples.clue: It gives true facts about polar bears

examples.text: A wizard waved his wand and made the frog turn into a prince.
George Washington was the first president of the United States.
examples.clue: It is a true fact about history
